This is actually a very serious problem, far more serious and pervasive than most realize, at every level.

Forgetting for a moment that an "extremist" as anyone who disagrees with the official narrative, and that this has become far worse than the Inquisition ever dreamed to be ... the sheer attacks on Constitutional rights alone are substantial.

"Congress shall make no law ..."  But that says nothing about the policies of private corporations.   Whether it is academic journals refusing to publish the work of  Forrest Mimms -- a legit scientist -- simply because he is religious, or corporations firing people suspected of wrongthink, the situation where corporations (who can only exist because of the state) assert powers under the guise of "private property" far exceeding those of the states that create them is pervasive, extensive, and subject to zero recourse.

This goes far beyond First Amendment issues as well.   Practically every employer has rules that not only disarm employees in their buildings, but prohibit weapons in car trunks for legitimate use after work.   

But then it steps beyond that.   Government ROUTINELY hires corporations to do things that, if done by government, would be clearly illegal, and this is not new.   The explicit payment of really nasty orgs like the SPLC and ADL for "intelligence gathering" not only allows practically the entire Bill of Rights to be bypassed with the victims having no recourse, but the information provided is deliberately stilted, allowing these private and unaccountable organizations to direct public policy in the same way media manipulates public opinion.   And because 99% of this incorrect information is classified, good luck finding out just how extensive and how incorrect it actually is.

This technique was also used for our "extraordinary rendition" program in which private contractors (including private airplane companies) were paid to transport people out of the country so they could be tortured, etc. in a place where there was "no controlling legal authority."

The evil this presents is practically without bounds.  It needs to be understood that anything government creates can have no powers exceeding those of its creator.   

The corporation is used as a mechanism to destroy all boundaries and evade responsibility.

For those who are not aware, Pusher is the company that provides a 3rd party notification engine, e.g. for chats, etc.  I learned this morning that this is the reason why notifications don't work great at the moment on Gab.  So, I took the initiative to reach out to Pusher's CEO in London and also engaged the head of Corporate Development in the Bay Area.
